types.name: Query
types.description: GraphQL Root Query Type

fields.name: bite
fields.description: Fetches a Bite given its unique ID.

fields.name: bites
fields.description:
Fetches an Array of Bites.
This query should not be used to query for specific Bites,
  rather be used to build an initial list of bites.

fields.name: categories
fields.description: Fetches an Array of Categories.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Fetches a Category given its unique ID.

fields.name: heartbeat
fields.description:
Check that the API is alive.
This query should be used by any service checking API uptime.

fields.name: search
fields.description: Perform a search for Content (Bites, Boards, Topics, etc.) given a query.

args.name: query
args.description: The search string to look for.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: Fetches a Topic given its unique ID.

fields.name: topics
fields.description: Fetches an Array of Topics.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Returns the currently logged in user.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Bite
types.description: Sound Bite object with playable audio object and associated metadata.

fields.name: audio
fields.description: Audio content of the Bite.

fields.name: boards
fields.description: Boards on which the Bite appears on.

fields.name: color
fields.description:
Primary color of the Bite represented in six-digit HEX (eg. #A1B2C3).
Should be used as a background visual fallback when `image` is unavalible.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Bite was created at. (eg. `"Wed Oct 15 2016 21:25:29 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Bite.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with Bite. Can be used for background visual.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Keywords associated with Bite

fields.name: owner
fields.description: User who created Bite

fields.name: playCount
fields.description: Amount of times Bite has been played by Users

fields.name: similar
fields.description: Similar Bites

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of Bite

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Bite was created at. (eg. `"Wed Jan 20 2017 14:18:22 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Visibility level of Bite

types.name: Content
types.description: A interface to base user-created content on the service on.

fields.name: color
fields.description:
Primary color of the Content represented in six-digit HEX (eg. #A1B2C3).
Should be used as a background visual fallback when `image` is unavalible.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Content was created at. (eg. `"Wed Oct 15 2016 21:25:29 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Content.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with Content. Can be used for background visual.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Keywords associated with Content

fields.name: owner
fields.description: User who created Content

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of Content

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Content was created at. (eg. `"Wed Jan 20 2017 14:18:22 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Visibility level of Content

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Image
types.description: An image with the various supported formats.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Image.

fields.name: original
fields.description: The original uploaded image file.

fields.name: square
fields.description: The image optimized and served in a square format.

types.name: File
types.description: An internet accessible File.

fields.name: contentType
fields.description: The media type of the File, as standardized by IANA.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique File.

fields.name: md5Hash
fields.description: Unique MD5 Hash of File to verify File's validity.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The given filename of the File.

fields.name: size
fields.description: The size (in bytes) of the File.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Internet accessible URL to access the File from.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: ImageSet
types.description: A collection of image files in the various supported scales.

fields.name: x1
fields.description: Base 1x-scaled image file.

fields.name: x2
fields.description: 2x-scaled image file.

fields.name: x3
fields.description: 3x-scaled image file.

fields.name: x4
fields.description: 4x-scaled image file.

types.name: User
types.description: A User of the Service.

fields.name: bites
fields.description: Bites owned by the User.

fields.name: boards
fields.description: Boards created by the User.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique the User.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The user's given display name.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The user's given username.

types.name: Board
types.description: A user-currated collection of Bites.

fields.name: bites
fields.description: Bites the Board is comprised of.

fields.name: color
fields.description:
Primary color of the Board represented in six-digit HEX (eg. #A1B2C3).
Should be used as a background visual fallback when `image` is unavalible.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Board was created at. (eg. `"Wed Oct 15 2016 21:25:29 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Board.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with Board. Can be used for background visual.

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: Keywords associated with Board

fields.name: owner
fields.description: User who created Board

fields.name: similar
fields.description: Similar Boards

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of Board

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Board was created at. (eg. `"Wed Jan 20 2017 14:18:22 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: visibility
fields.description: Visibility level of Board

types.name: Visibility
types.description: Esculating level representing a Type's Visibility to users.

enumValues.name: PUBLIC
enumValues.description: Visible to everyone. Search Engines and Other Bots included.

enumValues.name: UNLISTED
enumValues.description: Visible to anyone with link. Not indexible or searchable.

enumValues.name: PRIVATE
enumValues.description: Only the owner (and service admins) can view.

types.name: Audio
types.description: Represents a piece of Audio in the various supported Audio codecs.

fields.name: aac
fields.description: Audio File encoded in AAC.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique piece of Audio.

fields.name: mp3
fields.description: Audio File encoded in MP3.

fields.name: ogg
fields.description: Audio File encoded in OGG.

fields.name: original
fields.description: The original file uploaded by the uploading user.

fields.name: wav
fields.description: Audio File encoded in WAV.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Category
types.description: A service curated collection of Topics.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Category was created at. (eg. `"Wed Oct 15 2016 21:25:29 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Category.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of Category

fields.name: topics
fields.description: Topics the Category is comprised of.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Category was created at. (eg. `"Wed Jan 20 2017 14:18:22 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

types.name: Topic
types.description: A service currated collection of Content.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content the Topic is comprised of.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Topic was created at. (eg. `"Wed Oct 15 2016 21:25:29 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID to represent a unique Topic.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of Topic

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: Returns Date and Time Topic was created at. (eg. `"Wed Jan 20 2017 14:18:22 GMT+0000 (UTC)"`)

types.name: Mutation
types.description: GraphQL Mutation Root Type

fields.name: createBite
fields.description: Creates a new Bite.

args.name: audio
args.description: A audio file upload facilitated by graphql-multipart-request-spec.

args.name: image
args.description: A image file upload facilitated by graphql-multipart-request-spec.

args.name: startTime
args.description: The starting time to cut the audio clip in milliseconds (ms = sec * 1000)

args.name: duration
args.description:
TODO support endTime: Int
The amount of time of the audio to keep in milliseconds (ms = sec * 1000)

fields.name: createBiteFromURL
fields.description: Creates a new Bite From Youtube URL.

args.name: url
args.description: A string of a youtube url

args.name: image
args.description: A image file upload facilitated by graphql-multipart-request-spec.

args.name: startTime
args.description: The starting time to cut the audio clip in milliseconds (ms)

args.name: duration
args.description:
TODO support endTime: Int
The amount of time of the audio to keep in milliseconds (ms)

fields.name: createTopic
fields.description: Creates a new Topic.

args.name: biteIDs
args.description: The Unique IDs of the Bites to include in the Topic.

fields.name: createCategory
fields.description: Creates a new Category.

args.name: topicsIDs
args.description: The Unique IDs of the Topics to include in the Category.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload promise that resolves an object containing `stream`, `filename`, `mimetype` and `encoding`.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
